greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Concatenate exponents in prime factorization of n.
comment: a(n) = 1 for prime n; a(n) = 11, 111, 1111,... if n = product of two, three, four, ... distinct primes. - _Zak Seidov_, Dec 15 2006
The sequence of (nonzero) exponents in the prime factorization of n, sorted in decreasing order, is called the prime signature of n, cf. A124010. - _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 17 2008, edited Oct 12 2018
link: Zak Seidov and Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (First 2000 terms from Zak Seidov)
program: (PARI) primesig(n)=fromdigits(vecsort(factor(n)[,2]~,4)) \\ The same except for multiples of 2^10, 3^10, 5^10 etc. \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Apr 17 2008, simplified Oct 12 2018
def a(n): return 0 if n<2 else int("".join(map(str, factorint(n).values())))
print([a(n) for n in range(1, 79)]) # _Michael S. Branicky_, Mar 18 2021
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
